Any Infectious Disease which is announced or notified as an epidemic or pandemic by the health authority of Singapore or the Government of the Republic of Singapore, and a pandemic by the Whole Health Organisation (WHO). The cover for the epidemic or pandemic Infectious Disease shall cease from the date of such announcement or notification.

If at the time any claim arises under this Policy there is any other insurance policy effected by or on behalf of You with other insurance company covering the same expenses, We shall only be liable for the remaining amount which You are not compensated for.

### Section 8. Hospital Cash Benefit
questions: How does the policy handle coverage for infectious diseases that are declared epidemics or pandemics by Singapore health authorities and WHO, and what is the exact timing when such coverage ceases?

In the event of a claim related to an infectious disease, how does the policy coordinate benefits if the insured has another insurance policy covering the same expenses, and what portion of the claim will this policy pay?
What are the implications for coverage if an infectious disease is declared a pandemic by WHO but not by Singapore health authorities, or vice versa?
How does the cessation of coverage for epidemic or pandemic infectious diseases affect claims arising on the exact date of announcement or notification by Singapore authorities or WHO?

If a claim arises for medical expenses due to an infectious disease before it is declared an epidemic or pandemic, how does the policy apply, especially in relation to other insurance policies covering the same expenses?
What documentation or proof is required to establish the date of announcement or notification of an epidemic or pandemic by Singapore health authorities or WHO for the purpose of coverage cessation?

How does the policy define the scope of infectious diseases covered before the epidemic or pandemic announcement, and are there any exclusions related to diseases not declared by both Singapore authorities and WHO?
In cases where multiple insurance policies cover the same infectious disease expenses, how is the 'remaining amount' calculated and what is the insured's responsibility to disclose other coverage?
Does the policy provide any benefits or exceptions under Section 8 Hospital Cash Benefit for infectious diseases declared as epidemics or pandemics before coverage ceases?
How does the policy address claims if the insured is hospitalized due to an infectious disease after the epidemic or pandemic declaration date, considering the coverage cessation clause?
What is the interaction between the general exclusion of coverage cessation for epidemic or pandemic infectious diseases and any specific exclusions or benefits under Section 8 Hospital Cash Benefit?
If an insured has overlapping coverage for infectious disease expenses with another insurer, how does the policy handle coordination of benefits in terms of claim submission and payment timing?
Are there any provisions for coverage continuation or automatic extensions if an infectious disease is declared an epidemic or pandemic during an ongoing hospital stay under Section 8?
How does the policy treat claims for infectious diseases that are declared epidemics or pandemics by authorities outside Singapore but not by Singapore or WHO?
What happens if the insured fails to notify the insurer about other insurance policies covering the same infectious disease expenses at the time of claim?
Does the policy exclude coverage for infectious diseases that are only announced as epidemics or pandemics after the insured's trip or policy period has ended?
How does the policy define 'expenses' covered under infectious disease claims, and are there any limits or conditions when other insurance policies are involved?
In the event of a dispute between insurers regarding coverage for infectious disease expenses, what is the policy's stance on liability and claim settlement?
How does the policy ensure that the insured is aware of the cessation of coverage for epidemic or pandemic infectious diseases, and are there any notification requirements?

What is the relationship between the general exclusion for epidemic or pandemic infectious diseases and any potential claims under other sections, such as Hospital Cash Benefit, when such diseases are involved?
